definition: to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: He bowed to the Queen before speaking.
sentences.chinese: 他說話之前向女王欠身。

sentences.english: Mostly, people leaned forward in their seats and grabbed the rail of pew in front of them.
sentences.chinese: 多數人在坐位上向前欠身抓住前排坐位靠背後的扶手。

sentences.english: The beggar bowed his thanks when people gave him money.
sentences.chinese: 當人們給他錢時，那乞丐便欠身致謝。

sentences.english: Fatso leaned over to whisper in her ear.
sentences.chinese: 胖子欠身對她耳語幾句。

sentences.english: It is good manners to make just a slight bow .
sentences.chinese: 只有微微欠身鞠一個躬，也是很有禮貌的。

definition: to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
to have a smile on one's face
variant of 斂衽|敛衽[lian3 ren4]
to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
